articles.title: Gambling on wars? Prediction markets usher in a 'Wild West' of betting
The worrying new gambling trend luring boys to bet on airstrikes, Epstein and aliens
articles.summary: Boys are increasingly placing bets on everything from military conflicts and conspiracy theories to extraterrestrial disclosure through unregulated online platforms. This trend signals how prediction markets are bleeding into pure gambling territory, potentially attracting regulatory crackdowns that could hurt legitimate forecasting platforms.

articles.title: Everything can be a bet now – the rise and risks of prediction markets
Prediction markets have effectively made sports betting legal in Minnesota
US prediction markets: Risks and regulation ahead
Will Donald Trump's tie be blue?
Swalwell ally blocked from prediction market in California governor’s race
articles.summary: A political ally of Rep. Eric Swalwell got banned from betting on California's gubernatorial race on a major prediction market platform. The move signals platforms are getting more aggressive about blocking insider trading, which could reshape how political operatives and connected players approach these markets.

articles.title: 9 of the Most Bizarre Prediction Markets Open for State of the Union
articles.summary: Prediction markets are taking bets on everything from Biden's tie color to how many times he'll say "folks" during tonight's State of the Union address. These oddball props show how far betting markets have evolved beyond simple win-loss outcomes, creating new revenue streams while testing the boundaries of what people will actually wager on.

articles.title: Kalshi sues Utah officials over comments made, anticipated regulation of prediction markets
articles.summary: Kalshi is taking Utah officials to court over public statements they made about prediction markets and expected regulatory crackdowns in the state. This lawsuit signals prediction market operators are getting aggressive about fighting state-level interference before it kills their business in key markets.

articles.title: State of the Union odds: How long will Trump's speech last?
articles.summary: Sportsbooks are offering odds on how long Trump's State of the Union address will run, with bettors wagering on whether he'll stick to a typical 60-minute speech or drag it out past the 90-minute mark. The prop bet taps into Trump's well-documented tendency to go off-script and his love of holding an audience, making speech length one of the few political wagers where his personality quirks directly impact the outcome.

articles.title: Prediction market exchange Kalshi sues Utah over proposed prop betting ban
articles.summary: Kalshi has filed a lawsuit against Utah to block the state's proposed ban on proposition betting. The case could set crucial precedent for how states regulate prediction markets, potentially affecting whether other jurisdictions can restrict event-based trading that doesn't involve traditional sports gambling.
